Hello, world!

A client-server architecture based on Node.js to display daily weather forecasts.

Current search item

A complete map overview!

Use the map to look at weather around the world. You can scroll left and right or zoom in to a specific area. Click on weather icon to find more informatino about the city, temperature, and current weather.

About

Everything we do, we believe information is power and relevant information, nuclear. We believe gathering information is half the battle. The way we do this is by delivering information that is beatifully designed, simple to use, and user friendly. We just happen to make websites. Give us a try.

We love the weather. If it didn't change once in a while, nine out of ten people couldn't start a conversation. We also love technology, so we, a group of passionate postgraduate students at the University of St. Andrew's, decided to mash things up a bit. We sought to create a solution that served two things: clear information in a simple design.

Project

The objective of this project was to develop a website utilizing weather data from OpenWeatherMaps with a large group of people. It required us to establish the requirements and make design choices as a group. Additionally, we worked with real world data from several sources, mashing them up into a unique program.

API

The API's used in the development of this website are Bootstrap, GoogleMaps, and OpenWeatherMaps.
